verses.verse: Now <WG1161> concerning <WG4012> the collection <WG3048> for the saints, <WG40> as I have given order <WG1299> to the churches <WG1577> of Galatia, <WG1053> even <WG2532> so <WG3779> do <WG4160> you.

On the first <WG3391> day of the week <WG4521> let every <WG1538> one of you lay <WG5087> by him in store, <WG2343> as God has prospered <WG2137> him, that there be no <WG3361> gatherings <WG3048> when <WG3752> I come. <WG2064>

And when <WG3752> I come, <WG3854> whomsoever <WG3739> <WG1437> you shall approve <WG1381> by your letters, <WG1992> them will I send <WG3992> to bring <WG667> your <WG5216> liberality <WG5485> to Jerusalem. <WG2419>
And if <WG1437> it be meet <WG514> that I go <WG4198> also, <WG2504> they shall go <WG4198> with me.
Now <WG1161> I will come <WG2064> to you, when <WG3752> I shall pass <WG1330> through <WG1330> Macedonia: <WG3109> for I do pass <WG1330> through <WG1330> Macedonia. <WG3109>
And it may be that I will abide, <WG3887> yes, <WG2228> and winter <WG3914> with you, that you may bring <WG4311> me on my journey wherever <WG3757> <WG1437> I go. <WG4198>
For I will <WG2309> not see <WG1492> you now <WG737> by the way; <WG3938> but I trust <WG1679> to tarry <WG1961> a while <WG5550> <WG5099> with you, if <WG1437> the Lord <WG2962> permit. <WG2010>
But I will tarry <WG1961> at <WG1722> Ephesus <WG2181> until <WG2193> Pentecost. <WG4005>
For a great <WG3173> door <WG2374> and effectual <WG1756> is opened <WG455> to me, and there are many <WG4183> adversaries. <WG480>

Now <WG1161> if <WG1437> Timotheus <WG5095> come, <WG2064> see <WG991> that he may be with you without <WG870> fear: <WG870> for he works <WG2038> the work <WG2041> of the Lord, <WG2962> as I also <WG2532> do.

Let no <WG3361> man <WG5100> therefore <WG3767> despise <WG1848> him: but conduct <WG4311> him forth <WG4311> in peace, <WG1515> that he may come <WG2064> to me: for I look <WG1551> for him with the brothers. <WG80>

As touching <WG4012> our brother <WG80> Apollos, <WG625> I greatly <WG4183> desired <WG3870> him to come <WG2064> to you with the brothers: <WG80> but his will <WG2307> was not at <WG3843> all <WG3843> to come <WG2064> at <WG3568> this <WG3568> time; <WG3568> but he will come <WG2064> when <WG3752> he shall have convenient <WG2119> time. <WG2119>
Watch <WG1127> you, stand <WG4739> fast in the faith, <WG4102> quit <WG407> you like <WG407> men, <WG407> be strong. <WG2901>
Let all <WG3956> your <WG5216> things be done <WG1096> with charity. <WG26>

I beseech <WG3870> you, brothers, <WG80> (you know <WG1492> the house <WG3614> of Stephanas, <WG4734> that it is the first fruits <WG536> of Achaia, <WG882> and that they have addicted <WG5021> themselves <WG1438> to the ministry <WG1248> of the saints, <WG40>)
That you submit <WG5293> yourselves to such, <WG5108> and to every <WG3956> one that helps <WG4903> with us, and labors. <WG2872>
I am glad <WG5463> of the coming <WG3952> of Stephanas <WG4734> and Fortunatus <WG5415> and Achaicus: <WG883> for that which was lacking <WG5303> on your <WG5216> part they have supplied. <WG378>
For they have refreshed <WG373> my spirit <WG4151> and your's: <WG5216> therefore <WG3767> acknowledge <WG1921> you them that are such. <WG5108>

The churches <WG1577> of Asia <WG773> salute <WG782> you. Aquila <WG207> and Priscilla <WG4252> salute <WG782> you much <WG4183> in the Lord, <WG2962> with the church <WG1577> that is in their house. <WG3624>
All <WG3956> the brothers <WG80> greet <WG782> you. Greet <WG782> you one <WG240> another <WG240> with an holy <WG40> kiss. <WG5370>
The salutation <WG783> of me Paul <WG3972> with my <WG1699> own <WG1699> hand. <WG5495>
If <WG1487> any <WG1536> man love <WG5368> not the Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> Christ, <WG5547> let him be Anathema <WG331> Maranatha. <WG3134>
The grace <WG5485> of our Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> be with you.

My love <WG26> be with you all <WG3956> in Christ <WG5547> Jesus. <WG2424> Amen. <WG281> The first epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi by Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus and Timotheus.
